result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J Hedges

records.addlTxt:
1:03 PM Defendant Tyler J Hedges in court, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court confirms defendant is eligible for public defender representation. State reviews bond modification request. State objects to bond modification. Court denies request and will keep cash bond in place. Court advises defendant to reach out to current public defender for possible representation. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.

1:17 PM Defendant Tyler J Hedges appeared by video, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint. Court reads charges. Defendant will be contacting the public defender's office. Defendant inquired about a bond modification. Court advised to write a letter requesting such. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs, if released on bond - must undergo a screening in the jail.

1:38 PM Defendant Tyler J Hedges appeared by video, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reads charges. Attorney rights given. State speaks to bond. Court orders: $500.00 CASH with conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs, if released on bond - must undergo a screening in the jail.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
